intro: Hedysarum razoumowianum, commonly known as the Razoumovian sweet clover, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Hedysarum razoumowianum is also valued for its potential in soil stabilization and as a forage plant.
